Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CFPS_AMP_15 (cell-free protein synthesis-AMP 15, AI predicted AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: AI predicted, machine learning prediction of known protein sequences

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (33.93%) toAMP_12. K: 18%; F: 16%, L=R: 12%.Activity: active against E. coli (MIC 25 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 0.8 uM), A. baumannii clinical strain (MIC 1.6 uM), Enterobacter spp. (MIC 6.3 uM), K. pneumoniae DSM 30104 (MIC 1.6 uM), P. aeruginosa DSM 1117 (MIC 12.5 uM), S. aureus DSM 11729 MRSA (MIC 25 uM), E. faecium (MIC 1.6 uM), Y. pestis EV76 (MIC 12.5 uM), B. anthracis Sterne (MIC 16.7 uM), and S. pneumoniae D39 (MIC 25 uM).Toxicity: Human RBC: HC50 24.8 uM, highly hemolytic.Resistance development:no:bacteria:E. coli: E. coli did not develop resistance to the peptide after 21 passages.
Literature Information.Author: Pandi A, Adam D, Zare A, Trinh VT, Schaefer SL, Burt M, Klabunde B, Bobkova E, Kushwaha M, Foroughijabbari Y, Braun P, Spahn C, Preußer C, Pogge von Strandmann E, Bode HB, von Buttlar H, Bertrams W, Jung AL, Abendroth F, Schmeck B, Hummer G, Vázquez O, Erb TJ. 2023
Literature Information.Title: Cell-free biosynthesis combined with deep learning accelerates de novo-development of antimicrobial peptides.
